{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3219300,"name":"","username":"WilliamLi0623","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/williamli0623/{size}/195602_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-17T11:34:59.974Z","cooked":"

We have a REV PDH flashed to 22.0.3 version firmware. The problem is that it is always showing 12.0V on its screen. However, while using driverstation or connecting it with REV Hardware Client, the real voltage can be monitored in either software. We tried to clear everything on the PDH and reflash the firmware, but nothing happens. Anyone who had have the same problem?

Upgrade and Downgrade the firmware won’t help either. As we are going to have a 2022 offseason ( YES, it IS 2022, because we didn’t have a 2022 competition due to COVID in China), we have to use 2022 version firmware.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-07-17T11:36:10.160Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":438984,"topic_slug":"rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54764,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 6941 Programmer | IBDP M24"},"post_url":"/t/rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v/438984/2","custom_user_title":"Team 6941 Programmer | IBDP M24","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3219302,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-17T11:47:08.644Z","cooked":"
WilliamLi0623:

We have a REV PDH flashed to 22.0.3 version firmware. The problem is that it is always showing 12.0V on its screen. However, while using driverstation or connecting it with REV Hardware Client, the real voltage can be monitored in either software. We tried to clear everything on the PDH and reflash the firmware, but nothing happens. Anyone who had have the same problem?

Not adding anything helpful here but yeah I’ve noticed the same thing. Just never has been a high enough priority problem for us to deal with it

That’s so weird, considering I would imagine it should be an OTS component measuring and displaying the voltage, and not subject to firmware bugs

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-07-17T11:50:13.975Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":306,"readers_count":305,"score":66.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":438984,"topic_slug":"rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v","display_username":"Lavi Arzi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v/438984/4","custom_user_title":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3219306,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-17T12:03:29.734Z","cooked":"

I can’t find the post, but this is a known issue with the mid-late 2022 batch of PDHs. Does not effect usability of the part at all. I would rely on a multimeter if you need to check battery voltage, or look at the driver station if you want to see voltage while the battery is in the robot.

Edit:The Post

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-07-17T12:23:43.628Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":80.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":438984,"topic_slug":"rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v/438984/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3219307,"name":"Brendan Conover","username":"bcon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-17T12:03:35.633Z","cooked":"
REV PDH batch 12/22 battery voltage monitor problem Electrical
Hello all, @democat and I think there may be some problems with the 12/22 PDH batch. For us (7125) the PDH works perfectly normal, except that the battery voltage monitor seems to be very very messed up. With a fresh battery, that the DS states is roughly 13 volts will register as such on the PDH [image] After dropping to low 13, high 12 volts all the way to low 11 volts, the PDH gets fully stuck displaying only 12.0, and nothing else. [image] [image] When the battery drops to low 11V the…

Perhaps this is your issue

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-07-17T12:03:41.526Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":85.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":438984,"topic_slug":"rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/rev-pdh-batch-12-22-battery-voltage-monitor-problem/427571","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"REV PDH batch 12/22 battery voltage monitor problem","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/rev-pdh-screen-always-showing-12-0v/438984/6","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3219317,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-17T13:24:10.841Z","cooked":"

Contact Rev.
Get your PDH added to their list. Once Rev. develops a solution, they will let you know what process to follow. Most likely it will be a hardware switch out, or a full replacement, but they have not announced a solution yet as far as I know.

Pick up a 4 pack of these useful fellas and always know which battery is the next one to pull - and support an awesome FRC team!

andymark.com

BattHawk Pack of 4

The BattHawk is designed and manufactured by East Central Indiana Robotics, FRC Team 1720, PhyXTGears. BattHawk is a voltmeter which can take the place of a battery flag. It measures the battery voltage without discernible drain during a robot...

Yeah we have a couple of PDHs with that same issue. Here’s what I have used for several years with PDPs, and we just added to this year’s robot.

Screenshot_20230717-1211161111×740 102 KB

Tons of sellers out there. Similar to this one:

https://a.co/d/aBj2Adc

Hopefully REV will find a solution and make good on this.

WilliamLi0623:

As we are going to have a 2022 offseason ( YES, it IS 2022, because we didn’t have a 2022 competition due to COVID in China), we have to use 2022 version firmware.

While any competition can make their own rule, the game manual doesn’t require any specific version of PDH firmware.
